metadata.name: Weak or Abused Passwords In CLI
metadata.comment: Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI. An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('123456789')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('123123qwe')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('asd123.aaaa')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('decryptme')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('p@ssw0rd!')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pass8080')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('password123')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('test@202'))))

output.summary: Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI. An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate usage of the passwords by users via commandline (should be discouraged) 2. Other currently unknown false positives References: https://symantec-enterprise-blogs.security.com/blogs/threat-intelligence/espionage-asia-governments, https://thedfirreport.com/2022/09/26/bumblebee-round-two/, https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2022/10/25/dev-0832-vice-society-opportunistic-ransomware-campaigns-impacting-us-education-sector/, https://www.huntress.com/blog/slashandgrab-screen-connect-post-exploitation-in-the-wild-cve-2024-1709-cve-2024-1708
